ruleset.label: VM serial port connected over network
VM serial port connected to vSPC

option.value:
The time and date of this login have been sent to the system logs.
WARNING: All commands run on the ESXi shell are logged and may be included in support bundles. Do not provide passwords directly on the command line. Most tools can prompt for secrets or accept them from standard input.
VMware offers powerful and supported automation tools. Please see https://developer.vmware.com for details.
The ESXi Shell can be disabled by an administrative user. See the vSphere Security documentation for more information.

optionDef.label: Annotations.WelcomeMessage
optionDef.summary: The welcome message in the initial screen of the Direct Console User Interface (DCUI) and the Host Client.

optionDef.label: DCacheMemReserved
optionDef.summary: Memory consumed by CBRC Data Cache (in MB)

optionDef.label: Enable
optionDef.summary: Enable Content Based Read Cache

optionDef.label: COWMaxHeapSizeMB
optionDef.summary: Maximum size (in MB) to which the COW heap is allowed to grow

optionDef.label: COWMaxREPageCacheszMB
optionDef.summary: Maximum size (in MB) of VMFSSparse metadata cache size before cache eviction kicks in

optionDef.label: COWMinREPageCacheszMB
optionDef.summary: Minimum size (in MB) of VMFSSparse metadata cache size. Valid when cache eviction is enabled.

optionDef.label: COWREPageCacheEviction
optionDef.summary: VMFSSparse metadata cache eviction: 0 - disabled, 1 enabled

optionDef.label: host.TAAworkaound
optionDef.summary: Enable mitigation of TSX Asynchronous Abort (CVE-2019-11135).

optionDef.label: monitor.if_pschange_mc_workaround
optionDef.summary: Enable workaround for Machine Check Error on Page Size Change (CVE-2018-12207).

optionDef.label: security.host.ruissl
optionDef.summary: Require SSL to be used when communicating with the host over port 902.

optionDef.label: vGPU.consolidation
optionDef.summary: Assignment policy to place shared passthru graphics VMs on same physical GPU until full.

optionDef.label: Config.Etc.issue
optionDef.summary: Messages that are displayed prior to an SSH or local shell login.

optionDef.label: Config.Etc.motd
optionDef.summary: Messages that are displayed following an SSH or local shell login.

optionDef.label: guest.commands.sharedPolicyRefCount
optionDef.summary: Reference count to enable guest operations.

optionDef.label: Vdtc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to distributed tracing services.

optionDef.label: Hbrsvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to HBR services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Hostsvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to Host services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Proxysvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to proxy services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Snmpsvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to SNMP services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Statssvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to Stats services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Vcsvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggres related to VC services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Vimsvc Logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to Virtual infrastructure management services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: Vmsvc logging level
optionDef.summary: Logging level for the loggers related to VM services.

choiceInfo.label: default to the global log level.
choiceInfo.summary: default to the global log level.

optionDef.label: log.level
optionDef.summary: Controls the global log level.

optionDef.label: plugins.hostsvc.esxAdminsGroup
optionDef.summary: Active Directory group name that is automatically granted administrator privileges on the ESX. NOTE: Changing the group name does not remove the permissions of the previous group.

optionDef.label: plugins.hostsvc.esxAdminsGroupAutoAdd
optionDef.summary: Controls whether the group specified by 'esxAdminsGroup' is automatically granted administrator permission. NOTE: Changing this to false does not remove any permissions already granted to the group.

optionDef.label: plugins.hostsvc.esxAdminsGroupUpdateInterval
optionDef.summary: Interval between checks for whether the group specified by 'esxAdminsGroup' has appeared in Active Directory, in minutes.

optionDef.label: Remote esxcli disabled
optionDef.summary: Enables or disables remote execution of esxcli commands.

optionDef.label: Debug Managed Object Browser enabled
optionDef.summary: Enables or disables the Debug Managed Object Browser for the ESXi host.

optionDef.label: Enable webscript launcher page
optionDef.summary: Controls the availability of webscript launcher page.

optionDef.label: plugins.vimsvc.authValidateInterval
optionDef.summary: Number of minutes between each validation of all known users and groups - set to zero to disable validation.

optionDef.label: Enables or disables Host Profile pyEngine APIs.
optionDef.summary: Enables or disables Host Profile pyEngine APIs. Restart host agent service (hostd) to adopt new value.

optionDef.label: plugins.vimsvc.httpNfcLeaseTimeout
optionDef.summary: Number of seconds until an HTTP NFC lease times out due to inactivity. Applies to new leases only.

optionDef.label: plugins.vimsvc.userSearch.maxResults
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of users and groups to display in the Add Permissions dialog - set to zero to disable the limit.

optionDef.label: plugins.vimsvc.userSearch.maxTimeSeconds
optionDef.summary: Number of seconds to wait for a search for users and groups to return results - set to zero to disable the timeout.

optionDef.label: Limit the number of registered virtual machines
optionDef.summary: Enables enforcing the limitation on the number of registered virtual machines in the inventory.

optionDef.label: plugins.vmsvc.filterExtraConfigHotEdit
optionDef.summary: Filter out extraConfig keys being modified that are not on a pre-defined list of allowed keys when a virtual machine is powered on.

optionDef.label: plugins.vmsvc.guestWatchdogTimeout
optionDef.summary: Number of seconds to wait for the Guest OS to shutdown.

optionDef.label: plugins.vmsvc.productLockerWatchIntervalSeconds
optionDef.summary: Interval between checks for whether the product locker files are changed, in seconds. Set to -1 to disable checks.

optionDef.label: vmsvc.vsanVmRefreshRetryInterval
optionDef.summary: Number of seconds to wait for retrying vSAN VM refresh, option value '0' means disabling retry logic.

optionDef.label: ssl.keyStore.allowAny
optionDef.summary: Allow any certificates to be added to the host CA store. Disables CA checks.

optionDef.label: ssl.keyStore.allowSelfSigned
optionDef.summary: Allow non-CA self-signed certificates to be added to the host CA store.

optionDef.label: ssl.keyStore.discardLeaf
optionDef.summary: Discard leaf certificates when adding to CA store. Leaf certificates in a CA store are generally a misconfiguration.

optionDef.label: ssl.minPrivateKeyLength
optionDef.summary: The minimum length in bits to be used when generating a new host private key.

optionDef.label: ticketing.thumbprintTypes
optionDef.summary: Hash algorithms with which to generate host thumbprints, specified as a comma-separated list. Options are sha1, sha256. If no hash is specified, all hashes that are considered secure are enabled.

optionDef.label: vmacore.soap.maxSessionCount
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of authenticated VIM API sessions at any given time - set to zero to disable limit.

optionDef.label: vmacore.soap.sessionTimeout
optionDef.summary: Number of minutes until a VIM API session times out due to inactivity - set to zero to disable timeout. Applies to new sessions only.

optionDef.label: AllowWideVsmp
optionDef.summary: Allow VMs with more VCPUs than host PCPUs, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: Bound lag quanta
optionDef.summary: Number of global quanta before bound lag

optionDef.label: CommRateThreshold
optionDef.summary: threshold for inter-sched-context rate above which the contexts are considered to be related (in num/sec)

optionDef.label: CoschedCostartThreshold
optionDef.summary: costart threshold in usec, costart threshold should be less than costopThreshold

optionDef.label: CoschedCostopThreshold
optionDef.summary: maximum skew between vcpus in usec, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: CoschedCrossCall
optionDef.summary: 0: disable cosched on crosscall; 1: enable cosched on crosscall

optionDef.label: CoschedHandoffLLC
optionDef.summary: 0: handoff by switching pcpu; 1: handoff to LLC if possible

optionDef.label: CoschedHandoffSkip
optionDef.summary: only skip handoff if ready time is smaller than this threshold, in usec, 0 to allow skip always

optionDef.label: CoschedPollUsec
optionDef.summary: interval between coscheduling skew checks, in usec

optionDef.label: Credit age period
optionDef.summary: Period in milliseconds

optionDef.label: FairnessRebalancePcpus
optionDef.summary: max number of PCPUs to be considered when doing fairness rebalance, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: HTRebalancePeriod
optionDef.summary: average milliseconds between opportunities for a pcpu to migrate vcpus from within a core

optionDef.label: HTStolenAgeThreshold
optionDef.summary: the amount of htStolen time a vcpu can keep without being aged (in seconds)

optionDef.label: HTWholeCoreThreshold
optionDef.summary: a vcpu with vtime falling behind by this threshold (in ms) is eligible to use the whole core (HT only), 0 to disable (may violate resource settings)

optionDef.label: HostRebalancePeriod
optionDef.summary: average milliseconds between opportunities for a pcpu to migrate vcpus from within the whole system, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: L2RebalancePeriod
optionDef.summary: average milliseconds between opportunities for a pcpu to migrate vcpus from within the shared L2 cache, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: L3RebalancePeriod
optionDef.summary: average milliseconds between opportunities for a pcpu to migrate vcpus from within the shared L3 cache, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: LimitEnforcementThreshold
optionDef.summary: Only allows low-vtime children ro run when a group/VM's vtimeLimit is smaller than the global virtual time by less than this threshold (in ms), 0 to disable

optionDef.label: MaxSampleRateLg
optionDef.summary: Sampling system services at most (2^MaxSampleRateLg) times a second

optionDef.label: NonTimerWakeupRate
optionDef.summary: Disable P state if the running vcpu's non-timer wakeup rate is higher than this threshold, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: PackageRebalancePeriod
optionDef.summary: average milliseconds between opportunities for a pcpu to migrate vcpus from within a package, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: PcpuMigrateIdlePcpus
optionDef.summary: max number of PCPUs to be considered when doing pcpu idle rebalance, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: Quantum
optionDef.summary: Quantum in milliseconds

optionDef.label: UseMwait
optionDef.summary: use MWAIT vs. HLT in the idle loop; 0: use HLT, 1: use MWAIT if possible, 2: choose by cpu type

optionDef.label: Enable admission check per virtual CPU
optionDef.summary: Perform additional admission control check that per virtual CPU virtual machine minimum does not exceed the speed of a single physical CPU

optionDef.label: WakeupMigrateIdlePcpus
optionDef.summary: max number of PCPUs to be considered when doing wakeup idle rebalance, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: DCUI Access
optionDef.summary: One or more comma-separated local users which are granted unconditional access to DCUI, even if they don't have administrator role on the host.

optionDef.label: HardwareAcceleratedInit
optionDef.summary: Enable hardware accelerated VMFS data initialization (requires compliant hardware)

optionDef.label: HardwareAcceleratedMove
optionDef.summary: Enable hardware accelerated VMFS data movement (requires compliant hardware)

optionDef.label: MaxHeapSize
optionDef.summary: Maximum size of the heap in MB used for data movement

optionDef.label: AlgoType
optionDef.summary: Digest Crypto Hash Type (1=SHA-1, 2=SHA-256).

optionDef.label: BlockSize
optionDef.summary: Blocksize in the original VMDK to compute crypto hash codes. In pages of 4K size. Value needs to be power of 2.

optionDef.label: CollisionEnabled
optionDef.summary: Enable collision detection (0=disabled, 1=enabled)

optionDef.label: MaxDentryPerObj
optionDef.summary: Maximum directory entries cached per directory

optionDef.label: AllowUsbClaimedAsSSD
optionDef.summary: Permit claim rules to mark USB disks as SSD

optionDef.label: APD Token Retry Count
optionDef.summary: APD Token Retry Count

optionDef.label: AutoremoveOnPDL
optionDef.summary: Autoremove paths to a disk that is in PDL (Permanent Device Loss)

optionDef.label: BandwidthCap
optionDef.summary: cap on disk bandwidth (KB/s) usage

optionDef.label: Delay on busy
optionDef.summary: Delay in milliseconds for completion of commands with a BUSY status

optionDef.label: DeviceEnableIOLatencyMsgs
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable storage latency-related error messages from PSA

optionDef.label: DeviceReclaimTime
optionDef.summary: The number of seconds between device re-claim attempts

optionDef.label: Disable 4kn SSDs
optionDef.summary: Disable use of 4kn SSDs

optionDef.label: DiskDelayPDLHelper
optionDef.summary: Delay PDL helper in secs

optionDef.label: DiskMaxIOSize
optionDef.summary: Max Disk READ/WRITE I/O size before splitting (in KB)

optionDef.label: DiskReservationThreshold
optionDef.summary: Time window within which refcounted reservations on a device are permitted (in msec)

optionDef.label: DiskRetryPeriod
optionDef.summary: Retry period in milliseconds for a command with retry status

optionDef.label: DumpMaxRetries
optionDef.summary: Max number of I/O retries during disk dump

optionDef.label: DumpPollDelay
optionDef.summary: Number of microseconds to wait between polls during a disk dump.

optionDef.label: DumpPollMaxRetries
optionDef.summary: Max number of device poll retries during disk dump

optionDef.label: EnableNaviReg
optionDef.summary: Enable automatic NaviAgent registration with EMC CLARiiON and Invista

optionDef.label: FailDiskRegistration
optionDef.summary: Fail device registration if disk has only standby paths and supports only implicit asymmetric logical unit access.

optionDef.label: Fast-path latency monitoring interval
optionDef.summary: Time interval (in msec) to monitor the IO latency to evaluate eligibility for fast-path in PSA.

optionDef.label: IdleCredit
optionDef.summary: Amount of idle credit that a virtual machine can gain for I/O requests

optionDef.label: Maximum LUN
optionDef.summary: Only SCSI LUNs with LUN ID values below this value will be scanned

optionDef.label: Maximum number of IO intervals
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of IO intervals per device that can be stored in order to detect overlapping IOs to 4Kn disks

optionDef.label: Maximum reset latency
optionDef.summary: Delay in milliseconds before logging warnings and spawning new reset worlds if a reset is overdue or taking too long

optionDef.label: Maximum commands in NMP
optionDef.summary: Increase the maximum number of commands to be processed at once in NMP

optionDef.label: PVSCSIEnablePreemption
optionDef.summary: Enable PVSCSI Preemption.

optionDef.label: Path evaluation time
optionDef.summary: The number of seconds between FC path evaluations

optionDef.label: PreventVMFSOverwrite
optionDef.summary: Prevent overwriting VMFS partitions

optionDef.label: QFullSampleSize
optionDef.summary: I/O samples to monitor for detecting non-transient queue full condition. Should be nonzero to enable queue depth throttling.

optionDef.label: QFullThreshold
optionDef.summary: BUSY or QFULL threshold, upon which LUN queue depth will be throttled. Should be <= QFullSampleSize if throttling is enabled.

optionDef.label: ReqCallThreshold
optionDef.summary: Threshold in number of pending requests before calling into vmkernel to process the requests

optionDef.label: Reset latency
optionDef.summary: Delay in milliseconds between reset thread wakeups

optionDef.label: Reset maximum retries
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of bus reset retries. Set to 0 for no limit.

optionDef.label: Reset overdue log period
optionDef.summary: Delay in seconds between logs of overdue reset

optionDef.label: Reset period
optionDef.summary: Delay in seconds between bus resets retries

optionDef.label: Reset thread expires
optionDef.summary: Life in seconds of an inactive reset handle thread

optionDef.label: Reset thread maximum
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of reset handler threads

optionDef.label: Reset thread minimum
optionDef.summary: Minimum number of reset handler threads

optionDef.label: Retry unit attention
optionDef.summary: Retry all SCSI commands that return a unit attention error

optionDef.label: ReturnCCForNoSpace
optionDef.summary: Return CC 0x7/0x27/0x7 in the event where a backing datastore has run out of space as opposed to posting a monitor event to halt the VM

optionDef.label: SchedCostUnit
optionDef.summary: IO Scheduler block size for accounting

optionDef.label: SchedQ cleanup interval
optionDef.summary: Time interval (in secs) to cleanup per device unused schedQ list (default = 5 minutes).

optionDef.label: Scheduled QControl sequence requests
optionDef.summary: Number of consecutive requests from a virtual machine required to raise the outstanding commands to maximum

optionDef.label: Scheduled QControl VM switches
optionDef.summary: Number of switches between commands issued by different virtual machines required to reduce outstanding commands to CONFIG_DISK_CIF

optionDef.label: SchedQPriorityPercentage
optionDef.summary: Percentage of priority commands to serve from priority queue

optionDef.label: Scheduled quantum
optionDef.summary: Number of consecutive requests from one world

optionDef.label: SchedReservationBurst
optionDef.summary: Permit I/O bursts in mclock scheduler with reservations.

optionDef.label: SchedulerWithReservation
optionDef.summary: Disk I/O scheduler (0:default 1:mclock)

optionDef.label: Sector maximum difference
optionDef.summary: Distance in sectors at which the disk BW schedules affinity stops

optionDef.label: Shares high
optionDef.summary: Shares for high disk priority

optionDef.label: Shares low
optionDef.summary: Shares for low disk priority

optionDef.label: Shares normal
optionDef.summary: Shares for normal disk priority

optionDef.label: Skip device reset
optionDef.summary: Do not send Device/Virt RESET if No Cmds in Flight

optionDef.label: SllThrottleTime
optionDef.summary: Time (in msecs) I/Os to SLLs will be throttled in the event of a TASK_SET_FULL being received.

optionDef.label: Support sparse LUN
optionDef.summary: Support for sparse LUNs if set to one

optionDef.label: ThroughputCap
optionDef.summary: Cap on disk throughput (IO/s) usage

optionDef.label: Use device reset
optionDef.summary: Use device reset (instead of bus reset) to reset a SCSI device

optionDef.label: Enable PSA deferred work pools
optionDef.summary: A bitmask: 0x1 - adapter submission pool, 0x2 - device completion pool, 0x4 - device queueing pool.

optionDef.label: Use LUN reset
optionDef.summary: Use LUN reset (instead of device.bus reset) to reset a SCSI device

optionDef.label: Use report LUN
optionDef.summary: Use the REPORT LUN command to increase scanning speed for devices

optionDef.label: VSCSI Coalesce Count
optionDef.summary: Frequency with which the coalesce callback is called.

optionDef.label: VSCSIDisableNvmeRetry
optionDef.summary: Disable vNVME Retries in VSCSI.

optionDef.label: Minimum time between VSCSI Polls when vCPUs halt
optionDef.summary: When vCPU halt we poll VSCSI vHBAs for work, but at most do so this often. Time is in microseconds.

optionDef.label: VSCSI Poll Period
optionDef.summary: Time in microseconds between VSCSI polls.

optionDef.label: VSCSIResvCmdRetryInSecs
optionDef.summary: Time (in secs) to retry on transient errors for Reservation commands for MSCS CAB configs.

optionDef.label: VSCSIWriteSameBurstSize
optionDef.summary: Max number of split IOs per write same request.

optionDef.label: FSSLightWeightProbe
optionDef.summary: Enable light-weight efficient probe of ESX supported datastores

optionDef.label: BindToVmknic
optionDef.summary: Bind the FT socket to a specific vmknic

optionDef.label: FTCptConcurrentSend
optionDef.summary: Send non-diff pages in parallel with diffing rather than after

optionDef.label: FTCptDelayCheckpoint
optionDef.summary: Delay checkpoint if no network packet waiting

optionDef.label: FTCptDiffCap
optionDef.summary: Max percent pages via diffs (EXPERIMENTAL, failover will not work if not 100)

optionDef.label: FTCptDiffThreads
optionDef.summary: Number of threads for diffing pages

optionDef.label: FTCptDisableFailover
optionDef.summary: Disable failovers (testing only)

optionDef.label: FTCptDiskWriteTimeout
optionDef.summary: Time in milliseconds for backup site to wait for a disk I/O to complete

optionDef.label: FTCptDontDelayPkts
optionDef.summary: Do not delay network packets - for testing only

optionDef.label: FTCptDontSendPages
optionDef.summary: Do not send over modified pages - for testing only

optionDef.label: FTCptEpochList
optionDef.summary: List of potential epochs to try in order of increasing value

optionDef.label: FTCptEpochSample
optionDef.summary: Single epoch sampling time in ms

optionDef.label: FTCptEpochWait
optionDef.summary: Wait in ms after epoch sampling

optionDef.label: FTCptIORetryExtraInterval
optionDef.summary: Extra sleep interval (in ms) between retries on disk I/O error

optionDef.label: FTCptIORetryInterval
optionDef.summary: Sleep interval (in ms) between retries on disk I/O error

optionDef.label: FTCptIORetryTimes
optionDef.summary: Maximum retries on disk I/O error

optionDef.label: FTCptLogTimeout
optionDef.summary: Time in milliseconds to wait for FT log entries (read or write)

optionDef.label: FTCptMaxPktsDelay
optionDef.summary: Max number of packets in the delayed queue before forcing a checkpoint

optionDef.label: FTCptMinInterval
optionDef.summary: Time in milliseconds to wait between two forced checkpoints

optionDef.label: FTCptNetDelayNoCpt
optionDef.summary: Delay to impose on virtual machine network output in ms

optionDef.label: FTCptNumConnections
optionDef.summary: # of data connections to use for page sending

optionDef.label: FTCptNumaIndex
optionDef.summary: Index dirty pages by NUMA node. Workers will use the index to prefer local work.

optionDef.label: FTCptPagePolicy
optionDef.summary: Page placement policy for side data. < 2^16: Use a specific node mask, 0x10000: Put pages anywhere, 0x10001: Match nodes with virtual machine, 0x10002: Avoid matching nodes with virtual machine

optionDef.label: FTCptPoweroff
optionDef.summary: Power off the Primary VM after the next checkpoint

optionDef.label: FTCptRcvBufSize
optionDef.summary: TCP receive buffer size for the backup

optionDef.label: FTCptSndBufSize
optionDef.summary: TCP send buffer size for the Primary VM

optionDef.label: FTCptStartTimeout
optionDef.summary: Time in milliseconds for backup site to wait for data for the next checkpoint

optionDef.label: FTCptStatsInterval
optionDef.summary: Time in milliseconds between stat printing

optionDef.label: FTCptThreadPolicy
optionDef.summary: Policy for placing helper threads. < 2^16: Use a fixed NUMA node mask, 0x10000: Put threads anywhere, 0x10001: Match threads to a dynamic node index

optionDef.label: FTCptVcpuMinUsage
optionDef.summary: VCPU usage in percentage below which the VM will be considered for forced checkpoint

optionDef.label: FTCptWaitOnSocket
optionDef.summary: Wait when socket is empty

optionDef.label: Vmknic
optionDef.summary: Vmknic for FT vmkernel VNIC

optionDef.label: ChecksumIoSize
optionDef.summary: Size in blocks of a checksum read I/O

optionDef.label: ChecksumMaxIo
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of I/O chunks read in parallel for checksum

optionDef.label: ChecksumPerSlice
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of I/O chunks we read in each slice for checksum

optionDef.label: ChecksumRegionSize
optionDef.summary: Size in blocks of one checksum region, corresponding to one network request

optionDef.label: ChecksumUseAllocInfo
optionDef.summary: Use disk allocation info to help speed up the checksum process

optionDef.label: ChecksumUseChecksumInfo
optionDef.summary: Use disk checksum info to help speed up transfering valid blocks of data.

optionDef.label: ChecksumZoneSize
optionDef.summary: Size in regions of one checksum zone for which allocation information will be cached

optionDef.label: CopySnapDiskMaxExtentCount
optionDef.summary: Number of extents for a single snapshot disk that can be copied in parallel

optionDef.label: CopySnapFidHashBuckets
optionDef.summary: Number of hash buckets to use to track the snapshot disks open to copy to demand log.

optionDef.label: DemandlogCompletedHashBuckets
optionDef.summary: Number of hash buckets to use to track extents that have been written to the demand log.

optionDef.label: DemandlogExtentHashBuckets
optionDef.summary: Number of hash buckets to use to track extents that haven't been read.

optionDef.label: DemandlogIoTimeoutSecs
optionDef.summary: Timeout for IOs for demand log operations.

optionDef.label: DemandlogReadRetries
optionDef.summary: Number of times to retry an internal read (for the demand log) before aborting the delta.

optionDef.label: DemandlogRetryDelayMs
optionDef.summary: Delay in milliseconds for retrying a demand log write.

optionDef.label: DemandlogTransferIoSize
optionDef.summary: Size in blocks of a demandlog transfer read I/O

optionDef.label: DemandlogTransferMaxCompletion
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of demandlog chunks that are allowed in completion phase per disk

optionDef.label: DemandlogTransferMaxIo
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of demandlog transfer I/O chunks issued in parallel

optionDef.label: DemandlogTransferMaxNetwork
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of demandlog chunks transferred in parallel

optionDef.label: DemandlogTransferPerSlice
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of demandlog chunks issued per slice

optionDef.label: DemandlogWriteRetries
optionDef.summary: Number of times to retry a demand log write before aborting the delta.

optionDef.label: DisconnectedEventDelayMs
optionDef.summary: Time to wait (while attempting reconnection) before posting a 'no connection to VR server' event

optionDef.label: ErrThrottleChecksumIO
optionDef.summary: Throttle Checksum I/O errors.

optionDef.label: ErrThrottleDceRead
optionDef.summary: Throttle DCE Read errors.

optionDef.label: BitmapAllocTimeoutMS
optionDef.summary: A timeout in MS for how long we will wait to allocate a bitmap

optionDef.label: BitmapVMMaxStorageGB
optionDef.summary: An estimation of the maximum storage allocated per VM in gigabytes

optionDef.label: DemandLogIOPerVM
optionDef.summary: Number of concurrent demand log copies per VM

optionDef.label: HbrLowerExtentBreakTB
optionDef.summary: Disks with capacity between the min extent break and this number of gigabytes will have the lower extent size.

optionDef.label: HbrLowerExtentSizeKB
optionDef.summary: Lower extent size used for disks in kilobytes.

optionDef.label: HbrMaxExtentSizeKB
optionDef.summary: Maximum extent size in kilobytes. Used for disks with capacity over the upper extent break.

optionDef.label: HbrMaxGuestXferWhileDeltaMB
optionDef.summary: Maximum single SCSI command transfer size (in megabytes) that will be tolerated while a delta is taking place.

optionDef.label: HbrMaxUnmapExtents
optionDef.summary: Maximum expected number of extents for SCSI UNMAP commands.

optionDef.label: Share force salting
optionDef.summary: PShare salting lets you limit the transparent page sharing only between a set of VMs. PShare salting is controlled by the VMX sched.mem.pshare.salt option. The PShare salting option has three states: 0 - no salting or isolation between VMs; 1 - VMs that have the sched.mem.pshare.salt option set are able to share memory with VMs with the same salt; 2 - VMs that do not have the sched.mem.pshare.salt option set cannot share memory with any other VM, page sharing is possible only inside the VM. If the sched.mem.pshare.salt is present but empty, the VM gets its own unique salt.

optionDef.label: DVSLargeHeapMBPerGB

optionDef.label: DVSLargeHeapMaxSize

optionDef.label: DontOffloadInnerIPv6
optionDef.summary: Don't offload inner IPv6 CSO/TSO packets to physical NICs

optionDef.label: E1000IntrCoalesce

optionDef.label: E1000TxCopySize
optionDef.summary: e1000 tx less than or equal to this will be fully copied with no need for completion.

optionDef.label: E1000TxZeroCopy
optionDef.summary: Use tx zero copy for non-tso packets for e1000.

optionDef.label: EnableDMASgCons
optionDef.summary: When non-zero, enable the DMA SG constraints support in uplink layer

optionDef.label: EnableOuterCsum

optionDef.label: EnsMbufpoolMaxMBPerGB

optionDef.label: EnsMbufpoolMinMBPerGB
optionDef.summary: Minimum MB of the ENS slab memory to be allocated per GB of physical memory

optionDef.label: Etherswitch fast path
optionDef.summary: Allow Etherswitch fast path

optionDef.summary: Number of ports on the etherswitch x 2^N is the size of the hash table for looking up MACs

optionDef.label: EtherswitchHeapMax

optionDef.label: Etherswitch per-pCPU dispatch data number
optionDef.summary: The dispatch data number in the etherswitch per-pCPU dispatch data cache. (REQUIRES REBOOT!)

optionDef.label: FollowHardwareMac
optionDef.summary: If set to 1, the management interface MAC address will update whenever the hardware MAC address changes.

optionDef.label: GuestIPHack
optionDef.summary: Enable guest arp inspection IOChain to get IP

optionDef.label: Guest Tx copy break
optionDef.summary: Transmits smaller than this will be copied rather than mapped

optionDef.label: IGMPQueries
optionDef.summary: Number of IGMP Queries to send during after VMotion/Teaming failover

optionDef.label: IGMPQueryInterval
optionDef.summary: Interval(in seconds) for IGMP/MLD general query in multicast snooping

optionDef.label: IGMPRouterIP
optionDef.summary: Router IP Address for IGMP (generally not necessary to set this)

optionDef.label: IGMPV3MaxSrcIPNum
optionDef.summary: Max per-group srouce IP number for IGMP V3

optionDef.label: IGMPVersion
optionDef.summary: IGMP Version (2 or 3)

optionDef.label: LACPActorSystemPriority
optionDef.summary: The value of LACP system priority

optionDef.label: LACPEnableIndividualPort
optionDef.summary: Allow to set lag status down when all member link status is down

optionDef.label: LRODefBackoffPeriod
optionDef.summary: After adaptive LRO decided not to do LRO, how many intervals to wait before trying again.

optionDef.label: LRODefMaxLength
optionDef.summary: LRO default max length

optionDef.label: LRODefThreshold
optionDef.summary: After this # packets, evaluate whether to continue SW LRO

optionDef.label: LRODefUseRatioDenom
optionDef.summary: If SW LRO reduce pkt count to be smaller than ratio, continue to do LRO. Denominator of ratio.

optionDef.label: LRODefUseRatioNumer
optionDef.summary: If SW LRO reduce pkt count to be smaller than ratio, continue to do LRO. Numerator of ratio.

optionDef.label: LinkFlappingThreshold
optionDef.summary: Max number of link down events per minute before considering a link unstable (0 to deactivate)

optionDef.label: LinkStatePollTimeout
optionDef.summary: Link State poll timer period in milliseconds.

optionDef.label: MLDRouterIP
optionDef.summary: Router IPv6 Address for MLD (generally not necessary to set this)

optionDef.label: MLDV2MaxSrcIPNum
optionDef.summary: Max per-group srouce IP number for MLD V2

optionDef.label: MLDVersion
optionDef.summary: MLD Version (1 or 2)

optionDef.label: MaxBeaconVlans
optionDef.summary: maximum number of VLANs to probe with beacons.

optionDef.label: Maximum simultaneous beacons
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of beacons to send in one beacon cycle

optionDef.label: MaxGlobalRxQueueCount
optionDef.summary: Global max length of rx queues for all virtual ports on a ESX host that support queueing

optionDef.label: Maximum net Tx queue length
optionDef.summary: Maximum length of the Tx queue for the physical NICs

optionDef.label: Maximum page in queue length
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of paging requests to queue for guest DMA

optionDef.label: MaxPktRxListQueue
optionDef.summary: Maximum packet we can queue in rxList

optionDef.label: Maximum port Rx queue length
optionDef.summary: Maximum length of the rx queue for virtual ports whose clients support queuing

optionDef.label: MinEtherLen
optionDef.summary: Minimum size ethernet frame to transmit

optionDef.label: NcpLlcSap
optionDef.summary: beacon/color NCP messages created with this SAP (DSAP/SSAP)

optionDef.label: NetBHRxStormThreshold
optionDef.summary: Declare Rx Storm after this number of consecutive rx pkt drops during queuing in NetBH rxList.

optionDef.label: NetDebugRARPTimerInter
optionDef.summary: RARP timer will be triggered at this interval.

optionDef.label: NetDeferTxCompletion
optionDef.summary: Whether to defer tx completion to tx world. 1 for Try Completion. 2 For Always (Only in MQ Tx World case).

optionDef.label: NetDiscUpdateIntrvl
optionDef.summary: Set interval (in milliseconds) of networking discovery to update the VLAN information

optionDef.label: NetEnableSwCsumForLro
optionDef.summary: Whether enable software checksum for LRO

optionDef.label: NetEsxfwPassOutboundGRE
optionDef.summary: Whether outbound GRE traffic is passed by ESXi firewall

optionDef.label: NetInStressTest
optionDef.summary: If set to 1, suppress certain logs to avoid log spew.

optionDef.label: NetLatencyAwareness
optionDef.summary: Whether to check virtual machine's latency settings or not for vmxnet2/3

optionDef.label: NetMaxRarpsPerInterval
optionDef.summary: Max number of RARPs dispatched per timer callback.

optionDef.label: NetNetqNumaIOCpuPinThreshold
optionDef.summary: CPU threshold for pinning device queues in NUMA I/O

optionDef.label: NetNetqRxRebalRSSLoadThresholdPerc
optionDef.summary: Threshold percentage to rebalance RSS(Receive Side Scaling) queue

optionDef.label: NetNetqTxPackKpps
optionDef.summary: Max TX queue load (in thousand packet per second) to allow packing on the corresponding RX queue

optionDef.label: NetNetqTxUnpackKpps
optionDef.summary: Threshold (in thousand packet per second) for TX queue load to trigger unpacking of the corresponding RX queue

optionDef.label: NetNiocAllowOverCommit
optionDef.summary: Whether allow NIOC overcommit when a vNIC is in connected state for DVS

optionDef.label: NetPTMgrWakeupInterval
optionDef.summary: How often the PTMgr will wakeup and trigger the UPT mode switch in second.

optionDef.label: Packet allocation retry count
optionDef.summary: Number of attempts for allocating packet within the page

optionDef.label: NetPktSlabFreePercentThreshold
optionDef.summary: Percent of free network memory pool, below which an event is reported.

optionDef.label: NetPortFlushIterLimit
optionDef.summary: when input is serialized, this bounds the number of times a thread flushes the deferred list.

optionDef.label: NetPortFlushPktLimit
optionDef.summary: when input is serialized, this bounds the number of pkts a thread flushes from the deferred list.

optionDef.label: NetPortTrackTxRace
optionDef.summary: if enabled(1), collect statistics on potential tx race between concurrent threads.

optionDef.label: NetRCFAllowBPF
optionDef.summary: Allow to run BPF code in RCF

optionDef.label: NetRCFInsnType
optionDef.summary: The instruction type of bytecode in RCF

optionDef.label: NetRmDistMacFilter
optionDef.summary: Activate/Deactivate the MAC filter on distributed NetRM

optionDef.label: NetRmDistSamplingRate
optionDef.summary: Sampling rate on distributed NetRM

optionDef.label: NetRxCopyInTx
optionDef.summary: Whether to enable rx copy in tx worldlet/world.

optionDef.label: NetSchedCoalesceTxUsecs
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of microseconds the device can delay tx completions

optionDef.label: NetSchedDefaultResPoolSharesPct
optionDef.summary: Percent share given to unclassified traffic

optionDef.label: NetSchedDefaultSchedName
optionDef.summary: Default networking packet scheduler

optionDef.label: NetSchedECNEnabled
optionDef.summary: Enable net scheduler to send congestion notification to switch ports.

optionDef.label: NetSchedECNThreshold
optionDef.summary: Percentage queue utilization at which net scheduler will start sending congestion notifications to switch ports.

optionDef.label: NetSchedHClkLeafQueueDepthPkt
optionDef.summary: Minimum number of packets each HClk leaf node can hold

optionDef.label: NetSchedHClkMQ
optionDef.summary: Enable multiple hardware queue for hclk netsched. (0 is off. 1 and 2 means MQ enabled. With 1, user specifies the number of queues, while 2 is dynamic based on link speed.)

optionDef.label: NetSchedHClkMaxHwQueue
optionDef.summary: Maximum number hardware queue that HClock can use. Only used when NetSchedHClkMQ is 1.

optionDef.label: NetSchedHClkVnicMQ
optionDef.summary: Enable multiple VNIC queue for hardware send queue selection

optionDef.label: NetSchedHeapMaxSizeMB
optionDef.summary: Size of the netsched subsystem heap in MB

optionDef.label: NetSchedInFlightMaxBytesDefault
optionDef.summary: Number of bytes fed to the nic for nics with a normal (1Gbps) linkspeed

optionDef.label: NetSchedInFlightMaxBytesInsane
optionDef.summary: Number of bytes fed to the nic for nics that don't support tx completion coalescing

optionDef.label: NetSchedMaxPktSend
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of packets that we can send to the driver at a time

optionDef.label: NetSchedQoSSchedName
optionDef.summary: Default networking packet scheduler for QoS

optionDef.label: NetSchedSpareBasedShares
optionDef.summary: Enable shares scheduling only on spare bandwidth. Don't bill while doing reservation scheduling

optionDef.label: NetSendRARPOnPortEnablement
optionDef.summary: Ensure one RARP is sent immediately when a port is enabled

optionDef.label: NetShaperQueuePerL3L4Flow
optionDef.summary: Enable queuing per L3/L4 flow hashing

optionDef.label: NetShaperQueueSizeMax
optionDef.summary: Maximum shaper queue size

optionDef.label: NetShaperQueueSizeMin
optionDef.summary: Minimum shaper queue size

optionDef.label: NetSplitRxMode
optionDef.summary: Whether to enable automatic splitRxMode

optionDef.label: NetTraceEnable
optionDef.summary: Enable virtual network tracing

optionDef.label: NetTuneHostMode
optionDef.summary: Tuning mode for networking

optionDef.label: NetTuneInterval
optionDef.summary: Tuning interval in seconds

optionDef.label: NetTuneThreshold
optionDef.summary: Threshold for activating a tuned mode

optionDef.label: Net Tx do not cluster size
optionDef.summary: Transmits smaller than this will not be subject to clustering.coalescing

optionDef.label: NetTxStaticRelation
optionDef.summary: Whether the world should have a static relation to the VM VCPU

optionDef.label: NetVMTxType
optionDef.summary: World for asynchronous Tx for net devices. 1 for one tx context per vNIC. 2 for one tx context per VM

optionDef.label: NetpollSwLRO
optionDef.summary: Whether to perform SW LRO on pkts in netPoll

optionDef.label: No local checksum
optionDef.summary: Do not checksum local tx.rx frames

optionDef.label: Notify switch
optionDef.summary: Broadcasts an arp request on net handle enable

optionDef.label: PTSwitchingTimeout
optionDef.summary: Timeout (in ms) when asking the VMX/guest to switch in/out of passthru

optionDef.label: PVRDMAVmknic
optionDef.summary: Vmknic for PVRDMA

optionDef.label: PktAgingListQuantumSize
optionDef.summary: Quantum size for PktAgingList expressed in power of 2

optionDef.label: PktagingDropPolicy
optionDef.summary: Dropping policy for vmxnet3 rx burst queue. 1 for PKTAGING_TAIL_DROP. 2 for PKTAGING_RED

optionDef.label: Port disable time-out
optionDef.summary: Maximum time to wait for ports to complete I/O before disabling

optionDef.label: PortsetLockModel
optionDef.summary: The lock model version of a portset

optionDef.label: Provisioning Vmknics
optionDef.summary: vmknics used by NFC for provisioning operations.

optionDef.label: ReversePathFwdCheck
optionDef.summary: Block the multicast/broadcast packets that come back from physical switches in a teamed environment

optionDef.label: ReversePathFwdCheckPromisc
optionDef.summary: Block duplicate packet in a teamed environment when the virtual switch is set to Promiscuous mode.

optionDef.label: SendIGMPReportToUplink
optionDef.summary: Enable sending IGMP report to uplink

optionDef.label: TcpipCopySmallTx
optionDef.summary: Copy and tx complete small packets for tcp tx

optionDef.label: TcpipDefLROEnabled
optionDef.summary: LRO enabled for TCP/IP

optionDef.label: TcpipDefLROMaxLength
optionDef.summary: LRO default max length for TCP/IP

optionDef.label: TcpipDgramRateLimiting
optionDef.summary: Enable Tx rate limiting for UDP sockets

optionDef.label: TcpipEnableABC
optionDef.summary: Enable Appropriate Byte Counting for TCP (RFC 3465)

optionDef.label: TcpipEnableFlowtable
optionDef.summary: Enable route caching through the use of flowtable

optionDef.label: TcpipEnableSendScaling
optionDef.summary: Enable Send-Side Scaling (requires RSS)

optionDef.label: TcpipEnsMultipleRxContexts
optionDef.summary: Use multiple ENS contexts for vmknic RX processing

optionDef.label: TcpipEnsNetQRSS
optionDef.summary: Request NetQ RSS for vmknics.

optionDef.label: TcpipHWLRONoDelayAck
optionDef.summary: Delayed ack timer not armed for Hardware LRO (socket option needs to be set in addition).

optionDef.label: TcpipHeapMax
optionDef.summary: Max megabytes the tcpip module heap can grow to. (REQUIRES REBOOT!)

optionDef.label: TCP/IP heap size
optionDef.summary: Size of the TCP/IP module heap in megabytes (requires reboot)

optionDef.label: TcpipIGMPDefaultVersion
optionDef.summary: Default version of IGMP, in the absence of a querier

optionDef.label: TcpipIGMPRejoinInterval
optionDef.summary: Delay in seconds between automatic IGMP rejoins when no querier is present

optionDef.label: TcpipLODispatchQueueMaxLen
optionDef.summary: Max # of pkts queued into the per-protocol queue used for dispatching loopback traffic (REQUIRES REBOOT!)

optionDef.label: TcpipLRONoDelayAck
optionDef.summary: Delayed ack timer not armed for LRO

optionDef.label: TcpipLogPackets
optionDef.summary: Turns on packet logging for a vmknic on debug builds, in a circular & in-memory buffer (Takes effect during vmknic creation time)

optionDef.label: TcpipLogPacketsCount
optionDef.summary: Number of packets to log in the in-memory logger. 24570 packets take up about 1.2 MB, and Tx & Rx use separate buffers. (Takes effect during vmknic creation time)

optionDef.label: Maximum number of TCP/IP stack instances
optionDef.summary: The maximum number of TCP/IP stack instances that can exist concurrently. If you increase this number, you must also increase the TcpipHeapSize by about 2.5 MB per instance. Requires rebooting the host.

optionDef.label: TcpipNoBcopyRx
optionDef.summary: Avoid bcopy in tcp rx

optionDef.label: TcpipPendPktSocketFreeTimeout
optionDef.summary: Time Delay in seconds, for freeing UDP sockets that have pending packets for Tx completion

optionDef.label: TcpipRxDispatchQueueMaxLen
optionDef.summary: Max # of pkts queued into a tcpip vmknic by an execution context (applied when vmknic is created)

optionDef.label: TcpipRxDispatchQueues
optionDef.summary: Max # of dispatch queues used for RX. For low memory systems, this should be minimum value(REQUIRES REBOOT!)

optionDef.label: TcpipRxDispatchQuota
optionDef.summary: Max # of pkts dispatched into the tcpip stack by an execution context

optionDef.label: TcpipTxDispatchQuota
optionDef.summary: Max # of pkts dispatched from the tcpip stack by an execution context

optionDef.label: TcpipTxqBackoffTimeoutMs
optionDef.summary: Duration (in milli seconds) for which backoff is effective when the tx queue has reached the NET_TCPIP_TXQ_MAX_USAGE_THRESHOLD

optionDef.label: TcpipTxqMaxUsageThreshold
optionDef.summary: Tx queue usage threshold in percent at which to start throttling

optionDef.label: TeamPolicyUpDelay
optionDef.summary: Delay (ms) before considering an `uplink up' event relevant

optionDef.label: TeamingNUMAAware
optionDef.summary: Enable the NUMA awareness in Teaming

optionDef.label: TrafficFilterIpAddress
optionDef.summary: Alternate DVFilter internal communication endpoint

optionDef.label: TsoDumpPkt
optionDef.summary: detailed dump of every <n> pkts

optionDef.label: UplinkAbortDisconnectTimeout
optionDef.summary: Timeout (ms) waiting for pending calls to finish when disconnecting.

optionDef.label: UplinkKillAsyncTimeout
optionDef.summary: Timeout (ms) waiting for async when world is killed.

optionDef.label: UplinkTxQueuesDispEnabled
optionDef.summary: Enables dispatching of port traffic on multiple tx queues

optionDef.label: UseHwCsumForIPv6Csum
optionDef.summary: When non-zero, use pNIC HW_CSUM, if available, as IPv6 csum offload

optionDef.label: UseHwIPv6Csum
optionDef.summary: When non-zero, use pNIC HW IPv6 csum offload if available

optionDef.label: UseHwTSO
optionDef.summary: When non-zero, use pNIC HW TSO offload if available

optionDef.label: UseHwTSO6
optionDef.summary: When non-zero, use pNIC HW IPv6 TSO offload if available

optionDef.label: Populate legacy entries
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable populating legacy entries in /proc/vmware/net

optionDef.label: Use proc
optionDef.summary: Populate /proc/vmware/net

optionDef.label: VLANMTUCheckMode
optionDef.summary: Set the unicast/broadcast checking mode in VLAN MTU check

optionDef.label: VmklnxLROEnabled
optionDef.summary: LRO enabled in vmklinux

optionDef.label: VmklnxLROMaxAggr
optionDef.summary: LRO max aggr in vmklinux

optionDef.label: VmknicDoLroSplit
optionDef.summary: whether for vmknic LRO avoids aggregating all pkts into a single (> 2 ms) large pkt.

optionDef.label: VmknicLroSplitBnd
optionDef.summary: when VmknicDoLroSplit is non-zero, while pktList is larger than this number, lroSplit is not done.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet2HwLRO
optionDef.summary: Whether to perform HW LRO on pkts going to a LPD capable vmxnet2

optionDef.label: Vmxnet2PinRxBuf
optionDef.summary: Pin RX buffers for vmxnet2 clients (windows guest only)

optionDef.label: Vmxnet2SwLRO
optionDef.summary: Whether to perform SW LRO on pkts going to a LPD capable vmxnet2

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3AllowTruncation
optionDef.summary: Allow truncated packets to be delivered to the guest

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3CopyTrailer
optionDef.summary: Copy additional bytes of pkt not included in the total length field of ip header

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3ESPRSSAllowed
optionDef.summary: Allow RSS for IPSEC (ESP) over IPv4 if requested by guest/vmx.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3HwLRO
optionDef.summary: Whether to enable HW LRO on pkts going to a LPD capable vmxnet3

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3MaxPendingRxBurst
optionDef.summary: max # packets to drain from Burst Queue per call

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3MaxRxBurstQueueLength
optionDef.summary: Maximum length of burst queue allowed when configured via vmx option

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3NonTsoPacketGtMtuAllowed
optionDef.summary: Allow non-TSO/LRO packets greater than vNic MTU

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3PageInBound
optionDef.summary: max # pageIn requests to handle per helper call for vmxnet3.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3RSSHashCache
optionDef.summary: Enable RSS hash cache.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3RxBurstQueueEnableThreshold
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of entries allowed in Rx ring buffer after which vmxnet3 Rx burst queuing will be disabled in vNIC backend

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3RxBurstQueueLimit
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of packets allowed to be queued in vmxnet3 vNIC backend in rx path

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3RxPollBound
optionDef.summary: max # pkts to receive per timeout for vmxnet3.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3SetRSSHash
optionDef.summary: While using multiqueue delivery, set RSS hash while delivering the packet to the guest.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3SwLRO
optionDef.summary: Whether to perform SW LRO on pkts going to a LPD capable vmxnet3

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3UDPRSSAllowed
optionDef.summary: Allow RSS for UDP over IPv4/IPv6 if requested by guest/vmx. May result in out-of-order packets for IP fragments.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3WinIntrHints
optionDef.summary: whether intr hints are used for Windows vmxnet3.

optionDef.label: Vmxnet3usePNICHash
optionDef.summary: Reuse pnic computed RSS hash.

optionDef.label: VmxnetBiDirNeedsTsoTx
optionDef.summary: Need to see Tso Tx to qualify for tsoSplit bidirectional traffic condition.

optionDef.label: VmxnetBiDirNoTsoSplit
optionDef.summary: For bidirectional traffic, don't do tsoSplit.

optionDef.label: VmxnetCopyTxRunLimit
optionDef.summary: non-Win vmxnet2/3 tx will have at most so many fully copied tx's in a row (65536 and larger means never).

optionDef.label: VmxnetDoLroSplit
optionDef.summary: whether for vmxnet LRO avoids aggregating all pkts into a single (> 2 mss) large pkt.

optionDef.label: VmxnetDoTsoSplit
optionDef.summary: whether to split TSO pkts before LPD; 1: halved; 3: VmxnetTsoSplitSize; 2: hybrid.

optionDef.label: VmxnetLROBackoffPeriod
optionDef.summary: After adaptive LRO decided not to do LRO, how many intervals to wait before trying again.

optionDef.label: VmxnetLROMaxLength
optionDef.summary: LRO default max length for TCP/IP

optionDef.label: VmxnetLROThreshold
optionDef.summary: After this # packets, evaluate whether to continue SW LRO

optionDef.label: VmxnetLROUseRatioDenom
optionDef.summary: If SW LRO reduce pkt count to be smaller than ratio, continue to do LRO. Denominator of ratio.

optionDef.label: VmxnetLROUseRatioNumer
optionDef.summary: If SW LRO reduce pkt count to be smaller than ratio, continue to do LRO. Numerator of ratio.

optionDef.label: VmxnetLroSplitBnd
optionDef.summary: when VmxnetDoLroSplit is non-zero, while pktList is larger than this number, lroSplit is not done.

optionDef.label: VmxnetPromDisableLro
optionDef.summary: Whether to disable SW LRO when vNIC goes into promiscuous mode.

optionDef.label: VmxnetSwLROSL
optionDef.summary: Whether to use ShortLived for vmxnet SW LRO

optionDef.label: VmxnetTsoSplitBnd
optionDef.summary: when VmxnetDoTsoSplit is 1 or 2, use targetSize as the tsoSplit threshold if the overall pkt list already has this number of pkts.

optionDef.label: VmxnetTsoSplitSize
optionDef.summary: split (byte) size; only used if DoTsoSplit >= 2.

optionDef.label: VmxnetTxCopySize
optionDef.summary: vmxnet tx <= than this will be fully copied with no need for completion.

optionDef.label: VmxnetWinCopyTxRunLimit
optionDef.summary: Win vmxnet2/3 tx will have at most so many fully copied tx's in a row (65536 and larger means never).

optionDef.label: VmxnetWinUDPTxFullCopy
optionDef.summary: whether Windows vmxnet UDP tx is fullCopy.

optionDef.label: vNicNumDeferredReset
optionDef.summary: max # normalPkts per poll.

optionDef.label: vNicTxPollBound
optionDef.summary: max # normalPkts per poll.

optionDef.label: vmxnetThroughputWeight
optionDef.summary: How far to favor throughput in vmxnet behavior.

optionDef.label: Network I/O control physical NIC opt out option
optionDef.summary: List of physical NICs to opt out of network I/O control

optionDef.label: NmpPReservationCmdRetryTime
optionDef.summary: Time (in secs) to retry on transient errors for Persistent reservation commands for MSCS CAB configs

optionDef.label: NmpSatpAluaCmdRetryTime
optionDef.summary: Time (in secs) to retry on transient errors

optionDef.label: CoreCapRatioPct
optionDef.summary: The capacity of a core in percent. When exceeded, locality migration is rejected. Set to 0 to disable this check

optionDef.label: CostopSkewAdjust
optionDef.summary: way to handle costop skew, 0:do nothing, 1:interleave vcpus among clients, 2:allow vcpus on all nodes

optionDef.label: FollowCoresPerSocket
optionDef.summary: 1: if the vNUMA topology should strickly follow core-per-socket config, 0: to remove the restriction

optionDef.label: LTermFairnessInterval
optionDef.summary: duration of long term fairness interval in terms of NUMA rebalance period, 0 indicates that long term fairness is disabled

optionDef.label: LTermMigImbalThreshold
optionDef.summary: imbalance in long term owed, in percentage, required to trigger migration for long term fairness

optionDef.label: LargeInterleave
optionDef.summary: Always use large page interleaving; 0 to disable.

optionDef.label: Dynamic latency probe period
optionDef.summary: Time (in ms) in between dynamic latency probing

optionDef.label: LocalityWeightActionAffinity
optionDef.summary: Benefit of improving action affinity by 1.

optionDef.label: LocalityWeightMem
optionDef.summary: Benefit of improving memory locality by 1 pct.

optionDef.label: Migration imbalance threshold
optionDef.summary: Minimum percent load imbalance between nodes to trigger migration

optionDef.label: MigPreventLTermThresh
optionDef.summary: long term owed for a VM, in percentage, above which NUMA migration and swaps are disabled for that VM

optionDef.label: Migration thrash threshold
optionDef.summary: Maximum post-migration load imbalance as a percentage of pre-migration imbalance to prevent thrashing

optionDef.label: Minimum load improvement for single migration
optionDef.summary: Minimum percent load balance improvement to allow single migration.swap

optionDef.label: Monitor migration enable
optionDef.summary: Allow NUMASched monitor migrations. Set to 1 to enable; set to 0 to disable.

optionDef.label: Page migration enable
optionDef.summary: Permit NUMASched to manipulate page migration. Set to 1 to enable; set to 0 to disable.

optionDef.label: PageMigLinearRun
optionDef.summary: page migration candidates for linear scan, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: PageMigRandomRun
optionDef.summary: page migration candidates for random scan, 0 to disable

optionDef.label: PageMigRateMax
optionDef.summary: max page migration rate

optionDef.label: PreferHT
optionDef.summary: Prefer using HyperThreads on the same NUMA node over full cores on multiple nodes; 0 to disable.

optionDef.label: Rebalancer core count
optionDef.summary: Minimum number of cores per node required to enable NUMA rebalancer

optionDef.label: Rebalancer total host core count
optionDef.summary: Minimum number of total host cores required to enable NUMA rebalancer

optionDef.label: Enable rebalancer
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable NUMA scheduler rebalancer

optionDef.label: Rebalance period
optionDef.summary: Frequency of NUMA node rebalancing in milliseconds

optionDef.label: SwapConsiderPeriod
optionDef.summary: time between reconsidering a client for swap, in units of NUMA rebalance period

optionDef.label: SwapInterval
optionDef.summary: frequency of NUMA node swap rebalancing, in units of NUMA rebalance period

optionDef.label: Enable virtual machine swaps for CPU
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable virtual machine swaps across nodes to balance CPU load

optionDef.label: Enable virtual machine swaps for memory
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable virtual machine swaps across nodes to improve memory locality

optionDef.label: SwapMigrateOnly
optionDef.summary: frequency of NUMA VM migration only considerations, in units of NUMA rebalance period, 0 to disable pure migrations

optionDef.label: Configured OSData Location
optionDef.summary: The configured location of the OSData partition.

optionDef.label: CStateMaxLatency
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, avoid a C-state whose latency is larger than this value (us)

optionDef.label: CStatePredictionCoef
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, predict non-timer wakeup with error probability p, where CStatePredictionCoef = -ln(1 - p) * (1 << 20)

optionDef.label: CStateResidencyCoef
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, avoid a C-state whose latency * CStateResidencyCoef > predicted residence time

optionDef.label: CpuPolicy
optionDef.summary: Host power management policy: High Performance, Balanced, Low Power, or Custom

optionDef.label: MaxCpuLoad
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, CPU utilization threshold below which CPU frequency can be dynamically adjusted

optionDef.label: MaxFreqPct
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, do not use P-states faster than the given percentage of full CPU speed, rounded up to the next available P-state

optionDef.label: MinFreqPct
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, do not use P-states slower than the given percentage of full CPU speed

optionDef.label: PerfBias
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, Performance Energy Bias Hint, where 0-15 directly specifies preference on a scale where 0=MaxPerf and 15=MinPower, while 16-18 chooses an automatically determined value from a preset policy: 16=Low Power, 17=Balanced, 18=High Performance

optionDef.label: PerfBiasEnable
optionDef.summary: Use Performance Energy Bias Hint

optionDef.label: TimerHz
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, dynamic power management timer sampling rate

optionDef.label: UseCStates
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, use ACPI C-states when processor is idle

optionDef.label: UsePStates
optionDef.summary: In Custom policy, use ACPI P-states to save power when processor is busy

optionDef.label: RdmFilter.HbaIsShared
optionDef.summary: Allow local disks to be RDM candidates for Virtual Machines

optionDef.label: SEHelpersForOfflineCommit
optionDef.summary: No of Helper Worlds for commit operation of offline SE Disks

optionDef.label: ScratchConfig.ConfiguredScratchLocation
optionDef.summary: The directory configured to be used for scratch space. Changes will take effect on next reboot.

optionDef.label: ScratchConfig.CurrentScratchLocation
optionDef.summary: The directory currently being used for scratch space.

optionDef.label: ChangeQErrSetting
optionDef.summary: Change the QErr value of devices to 0x0.

optionDef.label: CompareLUNNumber
optionDef.summary: Consider LUN number when determining LUN identity.

optionDef.label: EnableCmdSanityCheck
optionDef.summary: Enable Scsi command basic sanity checks. This option can crash the system if Scsi Command signature mismatches

optionDef.label: ExtendAPDCondition
optionDef.summary: Trigger APD condition when paths are in unavailable states

optionDef.label: FailVMIOonAPD
optionDef.summary: Fast fail virtual machine I/Os on APD Timeout.

optionDef.label: LogCmdErrors
optionDef.summary: Log SCSI Device command errors.

optionDef.label: LogCmdRCErrorsFreq
optionDef.summary: Number of consecutive RC errors to be seen before logging SCSI Device command.

optionDef.label: LogMPCmdErrors
optionDef.summary: Log SCSI Multi-path plugin command errors.

optionDef.label: LogScsiAborts
optionDef.summary: Log SCSI abort errors and success.

optionDef.label: LunCleanupInterval
optionDef.summary: Timeout for purging stale LUNs. Any LUN which was seen more than the configured number of days ago, will be deleted by the daily cleanup operation

optionDef.label: MaxReserveBacktrace
optionDef.summary: Log a backtrace if caller exceeds SCSI_MAX_RESERVE_TIME or SCSI_MAX_RESERVE_TOTALTIME (debug only)

optionDef.label: Maximum reserve time
optionDef.summary: Maximum time (in milliseconds) a system-initiated reservation is normally held

optionDef.label: MaxReserveTotalTime
optionDef.summary: Maximum time (in msecs) a system-initiated reservation normally takes from issue to release (debug only)

optionDef.label: NvmeAdjustLocalNSQDepth
optionDef.summary: Allow dividing the controller queue depth among the namespaces behind the controller for NVMe Local devices.

optionDef.label: NvmeDumpAnalogPageNsid
optionDef.summary: Enable logging of ANA Logpage NSID list.

optionDef.label: NvmeMaxUnmapBlockDescriptorCount
optionDef.summary: Set maximum deallocate(unmap) descriptor count limit

optionDef.label: NvmeMaxUnmapLbaCount
optionDef.summary: Set maximum deallocate(unmap) size limit (in blocks)

optionDef.label: NvmeProbeLogVerbose
optionDef.summary: Enable verbose logging during NVMe device discovery.

optionDef.label: Passthrough locking
optionDef.summary: SCSI passthrough locking

optionDef.label: PcpusPerCompletionWorld
optionDef.summary: Allocate number of storage adapter completion worlds based on pcpus per world across NUMA nodes.

optionDef.label: ReserveBacktrace
optionDef.summary: Log a backtrace for all Reserve/Release pairs (debug only)

optionDef.label: SCSIBlockUnsupportedOpcodesAndPages
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable blocking unsupported SCSI opcodes and vpd/mode pages

optionDef.label: SCSIEnableDescToFixedConv
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable conversion of descriptor format sense to fixed for older plugins

optionDef.label: SCSIEnableDeviceLatencyHistogram
optionDef.summary: Enable or disable updation of device latency histograms

optionDef.label: SCSIStrictSPCVersionChecksForPEs
optionDef.summary: Only LUNs with version >= SCSI_ANSI_SCSI3_SPC4 can be PEs

optionDef.label: SCSI time-out re-stop time
optionDef.summary: Delay (in milliseconds) after a stop due to time-out before the stop is re-issued

optionDef.label: SCSI time-out scan time
optionDef.summary: Time (in milliseconds) to sleep between checking for timed-out asynchronous I/O

optionDef.label: SCSIioTraceBufSizeMB
optionDef.summary: Logchannel buffer size for per device IO tracing in MB

optionDef.label: ScanOnDriverLoad
optionDef.summary: Scan new SCSI buses on device driver load

optionDef.label: ScanSync
optionDef.summary: Force LU scanning operations to be synchronous if set.

optionDef.label: ScsiAllowDeviceSpinup
optionDef.summary: Allow device spin up, if device is in spun down state.

optionDef.label: ScsiPathSplitUseSimpleCloneBuffer
optionDef.summary: Use simple clone buffers to split IOs at path layer whenever possible.

optionDef.label: ScsiRestartStalledQueueLatency
optionDef.summary: Delay in ms before restarting a stalled queue

optionDef.label: ScsiTMHardTimeout
optionDef.summary: Timeout in milliseconds before signalling upper layers of wedged I/O (0 = Signalling disabled).

optionDef.label: ScsiUseVPDXCopyInfo
optionDef.summary: Use Scsi VPD query for XCopy Info.

optionDef.label: ScsiVVolPESNRO
optionDef.summary: Default schedNumReqOutstanding value for a PE LUN.

optionDef.label: TimeoutTMThreadExpires
optionDef.summary: Life in seconds of timeout task mgmt handler thread

optionDef.label: TimeoutTMThreadLatency
optionDef.summary: Delay in ms before waking up new task mgmt thread

optionDef.label: TimeoutTMThreadMax
optionDef.summary: Max number of timeout task-mgmt handler threads

optionDef.label: TimeoutTMThreadMin
optionDef.summary: Min number of timeout task-mgmt handler threads

optionDef.label: TimeoutTMThreadRetry
optionDef.summary: Delay in milliseconds before retrying taskmgmt which failed or for which the I/O did not complete

optionDef.label: TransFailLogPct
optionDef.summary: Percent of Transient failures seen on Scsi Device that will be logged.

optionDef.label: UseAdaptiveRetries
optionDef.summary: Use adaptive retries for transient errors.

optionDef.label: Account lock failures
optionDef.summary: Maximum allowed failed login attempts before locking out a user's account. Zero disables account locking.

optionDef.label: Account unlock time
optionDef.summary: Duration in seconds to lock out a user's account after exceeding the maximum allowed failed login attempts.

optionDef.label: Default shell access
optionDef.summary: The default value of the 'shellAccess' field if it is not specified explicitly while creating a new user account, when the caller has shell access.

optionDef.label: Password history
optionDef.summary: Number of passwords to remember for each user. Zero disables password history.

optionDef.label: Password maximum age
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of days between password changes. Affects all existing and new users.

optionDef.label: Password quality control
optionDef.summary: Raw options for pam_passwdqc PAM module. This value is used as is in PAM's configuration file, so use with caution.

optionDef.label: SSH session limit
optionDef.summary: Maximum number of SSH sessions for all users except user 'root'.

optionDef.label: MaxConnPerIP
optionDef.summary: Max number of TCP/IP connection per IP

optionDef.label: SendLowat
optionDef.summary: Send buffer lowat (%)

optionDef.label: SetNoDelayedAck
optionDef.summary: Set socket option to disable TCP delayed acknowledgements (Use this option under guidance of VMware support. Requires Remount)

optionDef.label: WorldAffinity
optionDef.summary: TX Affinity: 0 - Disabled, 1 - Issuing world, 2 - Exact RX world, 3 - Loose RX world

optionDef.label: SvMotionAvgDisksPerVM
optionDef.summary: Initial Storage vMotion Heap Size is proportional to this setting

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.auditRecord.RemoteEnable
optionDef.summary: Enable transmitting audit records to remote hosts.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.auditRecord.StorageCapacity
optionDef.summary: Audit record storage capacity (in MiB).

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.auditRecord.StorageDirectory
optionDef.summary: Audit record storage directory.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.auditRecord.StorageEnable
optionDef.summary: Enable audit record storage.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.certificate.checkCRL
optionDef.summary: Enable checking the revocation status of all the certificates in an SSL certificate chain.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.certificate.checkSSLCerts
optionDef.summary: Enforce checking of SSL certificates when transmitting messages to remote hosts.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.certificate.strictX509Compliance
optionDef.summary: Enable strict compliance with X.509.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.defaultRotate
optionDef.summary: Number of older log files to keep.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.defaultSize
optionDef.summary: Size of each log file before switching to a new one (in KiB).

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.droppedMsgs.FileRotate
optionDef.summary: Number of older dropped message log files to keep.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.droppedMsgs.FileSize
optionDef.summary: Size of each dropped message log file before switching to a new one (in KiB).

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logCheckSSLCerts
optionDef.summary: DEPRECATED - use Syslog.global.certificate.checkSSLCerts. Enforce checking of SSL certificates when transmitting messages to remote hosts.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logDir
optionDef.summary: Datastore path of the directory to output logs to. Example: [datastoreName]/logdir

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logDirUnique
optionDef.summary: Enable placing log files in a unique subdirectory of logdir, based on hostname.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logFilters
optionDef.summary: Double vertical bar (||) separated list of log filters. The format of a log filter is: numLogs | ident | logRegexp. 'numLogs' sets the maximum number of log entries for the specified log messages. After reaching this number, the specified log messages are filtered and ignored. 'ident' specifies one or more system components to apply the filter to the log messages that these components generate. 'logRegexp' specifies a case-sensitive phrase with Python regular expression syntax to filter the log messages by their content.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logFiltersEnable
optionDef.summary: Enable the use of log filters.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logHost
optionDef.summary: Comma (,) separated list of remote hosts to transmit messages to. Format is: proto://hostname|ipv4|'['ipv6']'[:port][?formatter=value[&framing=value]]. Protocol must be one of (tcp|udp|ssl). If a port is not provided, ssl and tcp will use 1514; udp will use 514. Formatter must be one of (RFC_3164|RFC_5424). Framing must be one of (octet_counting|non_transparent). The default formatter is RFC 3164; the default framing is non_transparent.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.logLevel
optionDef.summary: Log filtering level. This should only be changed when troubleshooting an issue with the syslog daemon. Values may be 'debug' (most detailed level), 'info' (default detail level), 'warning' (only warnings or errors), or 'error' (only errors).

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.msgQueueDropMark
optionDef.summary: The message queue drop mark (as a percentage).

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.remoteHost.connectRetryDelay
optionDef.summary: Delay before retrying to connect to a remote host after a connection attempt has failed (in seconds).

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.remoteHost.maxMsgLen
optionDef.summary: Maximum remote host transmission length (in bytes) when using the TCP and TLS (SSL) protocols. Messages longer than this will be truncated.

optionDef.label: Syslog.global.vsanBacking
optionDef.summary: Allow the logging and audit record storage directories to be placed on a VSAN. WARNING! Enabling this parameter may cause ESXi to hang.

optionDef.label: Logger rotations
optionDef.summary: Number of older log files to keep for this logger.

optionDef.label: Logger size
optionDef.summary: Size of each log file before switching to another for this logger (in KiB).

optionDef.summary: Number of older log files to keep for this logger.
